SENTENCE.STRING: (also spelled Allegany River, especially in New York state) is a principal tributary of the Ohio River, which
forms with the Monongahela River at downtown Pittsburgh's Golden Triangle "point."
is approximately 325 mi (523 km) long, running through the U.S. states of New York and Pennsylvania.
drains a rural dissected plateau of 11,580 sq mi (29,992 kmÂ²) in the northern Allegheny Plateau, providing the northeastern most drainage in the watershed of the Mississippi River.
tributaries reach to within 8 mi (13 km) of Lake Erie in southwestern New York.
has been one of the most productive areas of energy extraction in U.S. history, with extensive deposits of coal, petroleum, and natural gas.
